en.title: AI as collaborator, not shortcut
en.excerpt: How I structure prompts, curation, and post-processing when co-creating visuals with AI tools.
en.body:
![](/uploads/cc2688784b973fd7cff8cb33af0949b6.jpg)

AI tools help me explore directions quickly, but the real value is in how I curate the results. Each project gets a prompt library with input parameters and notes on the adjustments that landed.

I treat generated images as sketches. Photoshop, After Effects, or Cinema 4D adds the tactile finish and removes dataset artefacts so the final visual still feels crafted.

The article also covers the prompt structures I rely on, texture-mixing strategies, and how I stay transparent about authorship when collaborating with teams.

zh.title: 把 AI 當成共創夥伴，而不是捷徑
zh.excerpt: 分享如何規劃提示語、篩選與後製，讓 AI 參與視覺創作。
zh.body:
AI 工具讓我能在前期發散時快速看到不同的視覺方向，但真正的價值在於如何策展這些結果。我會為每個專案建立 Prompt Library，並記錄輸入與輸出的調整參數。

在選用素材時，我會將 AI 生成的圖像視為「草圖」，透過 Photoshop、After Effects 或 Cinema 4D 再加工，保留手工質地並避免資料集裡常見的偏誤。

文章中包含我最常用的提示語結構、質感混搭策略，以及如何在團隊協作時保持透明與授權。
